intro: Spigelia ayotzinapensis, commonly known as the Ayotzinapa spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with a contrasting throat. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, typically with a slightly hairy surface. Spigelia ayotzinapensis is adapted to moist, shaded environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting pollinators.
